All,

I have just posted the first release of Semiann to the files section
with the filename of Semiann 2004.10.24.01.33.zip.

Below is a snippet of the readme.txt file.


Jim O'Flaherty



#### What is it[Semiann]?


This an ANN implementation meant to work with optimally with NEAT
(http://www.cs.utexas.edu/users/kstanley/neat.html).  Semiann uses a
sparse matrix to fill out the nodes,   connections, weight, biases and
activation functions for an ANN.

There are three basic concepts to Semiann:
A) Graph
B) Network Configuration
C) Network


The graph defines the nodes (input, hidden and output) and their
connections.  The related XML structure may be both read and written.
 This set of classes are designed such that their instances are read
only to facilitate ease of use in multi-threaded environments.

The network configuration defines the attributes to decorate a related
graph.  An activation function and an optional bias value are
associated to a particular node.  A weight value is associated to a
particular connection.  The related XML structure may be both read and
written, and internally must refer to the graph upon which it depends.
 This set of classes are designed such that their instances are read
only to facilitate ease of use in multi-threaded environments.

The network is a statically created highly optimized java instance
maximizing computational throughput by eliminating any "optional"
and/or "conditional" instructions.  Internally, a factory looks at the
network configuration and is able to determine which network
implementation class is ideal (from a performance perspective) for the
configuration.  This version does not currently implement XML
persistence of the current activation state.  This set of classes are
designed to be read/write.  As such, the instances are not
multi-threaded aware.

Please see the javadocs (Semiann/docs/index.html) to peruse the
Semiann API in more depth.
